intro: Alsodeia megapotamica, commonly known as the Paraguay riverweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil, Paraguay, and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetland and riparian habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Alsodeia megapotamica plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and wildlife.
